item.title: C++ Textbased game help
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[code]// ConsoleApplication1.cpp : Defines the entry point for the console application.
//

#include “stdafx.h”
#include
using namespace std;

int _tmain(int argc, _TCHAR* argv[])
{
int race,choice;
cout << “Are you black or white?” <<endl <<“Press 1 for black, 2 for white” <<endl<<endl;
cin >> race;
if(race==1)
{
cout << “Which direction would you like to go?” <<endl<< “1 for North” <<endl<< “2 for West” <<endl<<“3 for South” <<endl<< “4 for East”<<endl<<endl;
cin >> choice;
if (choice==1,2,3,4)
{
cout << “You head towards that direction” << endl << “A cop sees you and you get arrested… for being black” << endl << “Game Over” <<endl<<endl;
}

		if (choice>=5) 
		{
			cout << "Congratulations! You pressed the delete system32 button, bye!" <<endl<<endl;
		}
}

if(race==2) 
	{ cout << "Which direction would you like to go?" <<endl<< "1 for North" <<endl<< "2 for West" <<endl<<"3 for South" <<endl<< "4 for East"<<endl;
		cin >> choice;
		if (choice==1,2,3,4) 
		{
				cout << "You head towards that direction" << endl << "A black guy comes and shoots you, soon after he's arrested."<<endl<< "You know... for being black." <<endl<< "Game Over" <<endl<<endl;
		}
		
		if (choice>=5) 
		{
				cout << "You're obviously black if you can't follow directions." <<endl<<endl;
		}
}
if(race>=3)
{
		cout << "NIGGER I SAID PRESS 1 OR 2"<<endl << "Game Over"<< endl<<endl;
}
if(race<=0)
{
		cout << "NIGGER I SAID PRESS 1 OR 2"<<endl << "Game Over"<< endl<<endl;
}
system("pause");
return 0;

}[/code]
how do I send this out
Congratulations! You pressed the delete system32 button, bye
but the you get arrested comes out too
at the same time
for some reason
like if you do 1,2,3,4
you get arrested comes out alone

Read full topic
